parallel.distributed

Class PDBTExecInitedClt

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.distributed.PDBTExecInitedClt

  • public class PDBTExecInitedClt
extends java.lang.Object
    thread-safe class implements the "Client" for networks of PDBTExecInitedWrk workers. Connects ONLY to a host server represented by the PDBTExec[SingleCltWrk]Init[~ed]Srv object to a specific host/port IP address. Once this client object connects to the server, the connection stays on, until the terminateConnection() method is invoked (this is unlike the PDBatchTaskExecutorClt class where a new connection is established and closed during each method invocation.)

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2015-2016

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      • submitWorkFromSameHost

        public java.lang.Object[] submitWorkFromSameHost(TaskObject[] tasks)
                                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                                 java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                                 PDBatchTaskExecutorException
        the main method of the class. Sends over the network the tasks parameter to the PDBTExec[SingleCltWrk]Init[~ed]Srv server, who then distributes them to one of the available workers in the network. Method blocks until results are retrieved.
        Parameters:
        tasks - TaskObject[]
        Returns:
        Object[]
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        PDBatchTaskExecutorException

      • submitWorkFromSameHost

        public java.lang.Object[] submitWorkFromSameHost(TaskObject[] tasks,
                                                 int grainsize)
                                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                                 java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                                 PDBatchTaskExecutorException
        same as the main method of the class submitWorkFromSameHost(tasks), except it also specifies the granularity of the breaking-up of the array of tasks into batches to be submitted to the workers.
        Parameters:
        tasks - TaskObject[]
        grainsize - int a value of 1 means the tasks are to be divided exactly among as many batches as there are workers currently available.
        Returns:
        Object[]
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        PDBatchTaskExecutorException

      • submitInitCmd

        public void submitInitCmd(RRObject task)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          PDBatchTaskExecutorException
        this method must be invoked only once, prior to any other invocation of the submitWorkFromSameHost() method. It sends to the server the RRObject to be executed on each worker connected/to-be-connected to the server, in order to initialize its state. The workers will execute task.runProtocol(null, null, null) silently (don't send anything back to the server), unless the task argument is of type OKReplyRequestedPDBTExecWrkInitCmd in which case all workers will send back an OKReply to the server upon initialization, and the server will wait before sending back to this client its own OKReply until at least one worker has been initialized.

        Notice that the server will close its connection to this client if the client sends an OKReplyRequestedPDBTExecWrkInitCmd but another init-cmd has already been received and set by the server that is NOT of the worker-reply-request-needed type.

        Parameters:
        task - RRObject
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if connection to the server is somehow lost (see discussion above)
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        PDBatchTaskExecutorException - if the method was called before or if task passed in was null

      • submitCmd

        public void submitCmd(PDBTExecCmd task)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                      PDBatchTaskExecutorException
        same as submitInitCmd(RRObject) except it may be called at any time during a program execution, instructing the server to whom it sends the command, to forward it to all connected workers (and to-be-connected workers) for execution. The workers will normally execute cmd.runProtocol(null, null, null) and send back to the server an OKReply for this cmd. If however the command is of sub-type PDBTExecOnAllThreadsCmd, then each worker will execute instead the method PDBatchTaskExecutor.executeTaskOnAllThreads(cmd) which will cause the cmd.run() method of same command object on each thread in the executor's thread-pool, and will then send the OKReply back to the server for the server to eventually send back to this client the OKReply too.
        Parameters:
        task - PDBTExecCmd
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        PDBatchTaskExecutorException

      • terminateConnection

        public void terminateConnection()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        closes the connection to the server, causing server to release resources.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
